definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

pinyin: nei4 bao4 fa3 yuan2 zi3 dan4

sentences.english: The hypocenter and Atom Bomb Dome are visible at top center.
sentences.chinese: 在震源和原子彈圓頂可見頂部中心。

sentences.english: A hydrogen bomb has a built-in atomic bomb, which is needed to trigger the fusion reaction.
sentences.chinese: 氫彈內置了一顆原子彈，用於觸發聚變反應。

sentences.english: May scientists who supported the prodution of atomic bombs are advocates of peace.
sentences.chinese: 許多支持生產原子彈的科學家是和平的擁護者。

sentences.english: The US throwed two atomic bombs for force a showdown during the WWII.
sentences.chinese: 二戰期間美國投下兩顆原子彈迫使對方攤牌。

sentences.english: Technology and science begat both the Internet and the atom bomb, after all.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟，科學技術既發明了因特網，也發明了原子彈。

sentences.english: He drafted the model of the atomic warhead.
sentences.chinese: 他畫了原子彈頭模型的草圖。

sentences.english: A woman once unfeeling, more destructive than the atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 女人一旦絕情，比原子彈更具有摧毀性。

sentences.english: In U. S. the atomic bomb was produced by the electric monopoly-capitalist.
sentences.chinese: 美國的原子彈是由電氣業的壟斷資本家生產的。

sentences.english: Shingyouji Temple is about 3 km away from the point of detonation.
sentences.chinese: 真行寺寺廟距離引爆原子彈的地方只有三公里。

sentences.english: My first thought was of a TV movie I saw once about nuclear fallout.
sentences.chinese: 我的第一個念頭是在一場電視中看過的原子彈落塵。

sentences.english: The city was hit by an atomic bomb.
sentences.chinese: 該市曾遭受過原子彈的轟炸。

sentences.english: Under that general policy, research on the atomic bomb was begun.
sentences.chinese: 在這一總方針的指導下，原子彈方面的研究開始了。

sentences.english: When the first atomic bomb exploded, the whole world was shocked.
sentences.chinese: 第一顆原子彈爆炸的時候，轟動整個瀛寰。

sentences.english: The atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima had a yield of20 kilotons .
sentences.chinese: 落在廣島的原子彈產生出二萬噸的當量。

sentences.english: One, Project Orion, would have been powered by nuclear bombs.
sentences.chinese: 其中一個“獵戶星”項目，由原子彈提供能量。

sentences.english: Mathematicians broke the Japanese codes and built A-bomb .
sentences.chinese: 是數學家破解了日軍的密碼，發明了原子彈。

definition: Soviet Union, 1922-1991/abbr. for Union of Soviet Socialist Republics (USSR) 蘇維埃社會主義共和國聯盟|苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟[Su1 wei2 ai1 She4 hui4 zhu3 yi4 Gong4 he2 guo2 Lian2 meng2]

pinyin: Di4 er4 Ci4 Shi4 jie4 Da4 zhan4

definition: Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Chen Yi (1901-1972), communist general and politician, Marshal of PLA from 1955, Mayor of Shanghai in 1950s, PRC foreign minister 1958-1972
Treaty of Shimonoseki (1895), concluding the First Sino-Japanese War 甲午戰爭|甲午战争[Jia3 wu3 Zhan4 zheng1]
